person.persName: Thomas Carmichael Hindman (Phillips County, Arkansas, lawyer, politician, and major general (C.S.A.) )

body.p: Phillips County, Arkansas, lawyer, politician, and major general (C.S.A.). Knoxville, Tennessee, native. Son of Thomas Carmichael Hindman, Sr., and Sarah Hindman. Married to Mary Hindman. Father of Susan Hindman, Sally Hindman, Biscoe Hindman, and Thomas Hindman. Resident in Calhoun County, Alabama, in 1832. Resident in Tippah County, Mississippi, in 1841. Graduate of Lawrenceville Classical Institute in Lawrenceville, New Jersey, in 1846. Lawyer in Tippah County, Mississippi, from 1851 to 1853. Resident in Phillips County, Arkansas, in 1853. Member of the Arkansas State House of Representatives in Little Rock, Arkansas, from 1854 to 1856. Member of the United States House of Representatives from 1859 to 1861. Lawyer in Phillips County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Phillips County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Arkansas Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a colonel from June 21, 1861, to September 28, 1861. Served in the Provisional Army of the Confederate States as a brigadier general and a major general from September 28, 1861 to April 18, 1862.
